> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=tree)

# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=h1) Report

> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=tree)

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [bb43726...e0c720d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25091?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Related unexpected behavior:
```python
# TypeError: Cannot cast array data from dtype('float64') to dtype('<U32') according to the rule 'safe'
'foo' in pd.Categorical(pd.interval_range(0.1, 0.2))
```
Works as expected for ints:
```python
'foo' in pd.Categorical(pd.interval_range(42, 43))
```


`.get_loc()` shuld not be raisin `TypeError`.
Closing for now given this hasn't been updated in a few weeks but ping if you'd like to reopen. The first and most important part of any PR is tests, so make sure you have that squared away first
